Class CovidPlotter

  • java.lang.Object
    • CovidPlotter
  • public class CovidPlotter
extends java.lang.Object
    This program allows the user to view the amount of deaths from Covid-19 over a period of 240 days for all countries specified in the form of a graph. They may request cumulative or daily death plots. Users can select countries and plot types until they choose to quit.
    Author:
    gerne

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CovidPlotter()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double[] getDays​(int howMany)
      This function creates an array of day numbers that matches the number of entries in the cumulative deaths array.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main function that will display the cumulative or daily death plot of whichever country/countries the user enters.
      static void printWelcome()
      This function prints a welcome banner for the user
      static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​double[]> readData​(java.util.Scanner fsc)
      This function creates a linked hash map whose keys are the names of countries and values are arrays of number of cumulative deaths from the text file that the user enters.
      static void setUpAndShowPlot​(org.math.plot.Plot2DPanel plot, java.lang.String choice)
      This function creates the plot environment that will be displayed to the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CovidPlotter

        public CovidPlotter()

    • Method Detail

      • printWelcome

        public static void printWelcome()
        This function prints a welcome banner for the user

      • readData

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,​double[]> readData​(java.util.Scanner fsc)
        This function creates a linked hash map whose keys are the names of countries and values are arrays of number of cumulative deaths from the text file that the user enters.
        Parameters:
        fsc - The scanner object used to read user's choice of file
        Returns:
        The linked hash map with keys as names of countries and values as arrays of death counts

      • getDays

        public static double[] getDays​(int howMany)
        This function creates an array of day numbers that matches the number of entries in the cumulative deaths array.
        Parameters:
        howMany - The number of entries in the array as an integer
        Returns:
        The array filled out with day numbers

      • setUpAndShowPlot

        public static void setUpAndShowPlot​(org.math.plot.Plot2DPanel plot,
                                    java.lang.String choice)
        This function creates the plot environment that will be displayed to the user. The plot title will vary based on user choice (cumulative vs. daily death counts).
        Parameters:
        plot - The plot object where plot will be displayed
        choice - The user choice as a String indicating which plot type they'd like to see (C or D)

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Main function that will display the cumulative or daily death plot of whichever country/countries the user enters. The user will continue to be prompted to choose their countries of interest and plot types until they choose to quit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
